chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:18 AM Defendant Thomas P Diedrich in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Thomas P Diedrich.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:24 AM Defendant Thomas P Diedrich in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Thomas P Diedrich. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Response letter to defendant with attorney information.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $250.00 per month commencing October 1, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:27 AM Defendant Thomas P Diedrich in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and reads the criminal complaint to the defendant on the record. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court takes a short recess at 9:37 AM to allow for the defendant to be evaluated by the Public Defender's Office. Matter recalled at 9:58 AM with the same appearances. Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $250.00 per month commencing October 1, 2022. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
